alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 1:28PM CDT until August 30 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Williamson County in south central Texas... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 128 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Georgetown, Serenada, Leander, Bartlett, Liberty Hill, Jarrell, Sun City, Georgetown Dam, Theon, Walburg, Schwertner and Seward Junction. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
